critique: The document pertains to labor regulations and overtime pay for laborers and mechanics employed by the Department of Defense and the Department of the Interior. It ensures that overtime is paid at a rate not less than time and one-half for all hours of work exceeding eight hours in a day. There is no explicit discussion of immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, or social inclusion. The document seems to lean towards government intervention in economic matters by setting wage standards.
